section.title: Creating Additional Cloud Admins
section.p: You can create additional Cloud Admins to help with the administration of your cloud.

Additional Cloud Admins can be created by first creating users in the default admin domain using Horizon or the OpenStack command-line client. If you are using the command-line client to create the new Cloud Admin user, you must first set your credentials to an existing Cloud Admin in the keystone.osrc file.

Example keystone.osrc file: # Refer http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/command-list.html
# Environment variables for keystone v3 API using openstack client
# Keystone requires domain scoped token
unset OS_PROJECT_NAME unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME
export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME=Default export OS_PASSWORD=<REDACTED> export OS_DOMAIN_NAME=Default export OS_AUTH_URL=http://<HOST_IP>:5000/v3 export OS_INTERFACE=internal export OS_CACERT=/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
# Environment variables for openstack client v3 API if you are using hardcoded ADMIN token # Note if you use the env variables below, this takes precedence. #export OS_TOKEN=<REDACTED> #export OS_URL=http://<HOST_IP>:5000/v3

You will need to source the keystone.osrc file once you have set the proper credentials for an existing Cloud Admin. Once the Cloud Admin environment variables are set, execute the following command-line command to assign the Admin role: openstack role add --domain default --user USERNAME --user-domain default admin

p.note: In the example above, it's assumed that the default admin domain's name has not been altered from the default of default.
